items.title: Capitalism vs. the bird flu
items.author: Nilay Patel
items.summary:
- Discussion on the bird flu and its implications on egg prices and agriculture.
- First confirmed human death linked to bird flu reported in January.
- Concerns about new H5N1 strains spreading to other animals, including cows.
- Criticism of Robert Kennedy Jr. and his handling of public health in relation to bird flu.
- Industrial agriculture's vulnerability highlighted amid potential bird flu outbreaks.
- Need for collective action to manage bird flu effectively.

items.title: GMC Sierra electric truck now starts at $64,495 with new Elevation and ATF trims
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins

items.title: All the news from Nintendo’s March Direct showcase
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Nintendo will host a 30-minute Direct showcase on March 27th at 10AM ET.
- The Direct will focus on upcoming games for the Nintendo Switch, with no news about the upcoming Switch 2.
- Potential announcements may include remasters of classic titles like The Legend of Zelda: Wind Waker and Twilight Princess.

items.title: Google Maps can soon scan your screenshots to plan your vacation
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Google Maps is adding a feature that identifies locations in users' screenshots and saves them to a list for trip planning.
- The screenshot list feature is powered by Gemini and will roll out to iOS users in the US this week, with Android support coming soon.
- New itinerary-building features for travel planning in Google Search can create trip ideas based on user queries, available in English this week.
- Price drop alerts for Google Flights are now also available for hotel searches globally, allowing users to receive notifications for chosen dates and destinations.

items.title: Instacart will pay shoppers to take videos of store shelves
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Instacart introduces Store View, allowing shoppers to earn money by recording videos of store shelves to track product availability.
- The data collected will help Instacart's predictive models to estimate restock times for items.
- Store View will launch with select retailers soon, expanding across the US and Canada through 2025.
- Instacart is also rolling out Second Store Check to find out-of-stock items from alternative locations without extra fees.

items.title: Want to feel like a spy? Stick a smart chip in your manicure
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- The Jakcom N3 Smart Nail Chip can transmit data using NFC technology similar to contactless payments.
- Available in sets priced at $20, $36, and $60, it can be programmed for various functions like contact sharing or quick texts.
- Users may face challenges with securing the chip on nails and achieving reliable scans with mobile devices.
- The experience can vary significantly based on the application method of the chip and nail type used.
- Additional features allow users to program the chip for more personalized tasks, expanding its utility beyond its default settings.

items.title: Garmin adds AI and a subscription tier to its app
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Garmin has launched Garmin Connect Plus, a premium app tier offering AI-powered insights and features.
- Users can opt for a 30-day free trial, followed by a subscription of $6.99 monthly or $69.99 annually.
- Existing health data and features will remain free and accessible.
- The new feature, Active Intelligence, will provide personalized insights based on user health and activity data.
- Connect Plus includes a performance dashboard, live activity metrics on smartphones, and expanded LiveTrack features.
- Garmin continues to face competition from brands like Apple and Samsung in the wearable tech market.

items.title: Vivaldi bundles Proton VPN into its web browser
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Vivaldi integrates the free version of Proton VPN directly into its web browser, available today for desktop users.
- Users can log in with a Vivaldi account to access Proton VPN, which allows connections to servers in five randomly selected countries.
- Paid Proton VPN upgrades are available from $10/month for enhanced speed and server options across more than 110 countries.
- This integration aims to make VPN access easier and more accessible compared to traditional browser extensions.
- The partnership emphasizes shared values between Vivaldi and Proton, focusing on privacy and independence from major tech influences.

items.title: Uber Shuttle will get you to JFK airport for $10
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Uber is expanding its airport shuttle service to JFK for $10 until April 30th, after which it will increase to $25.
- The shuttle aims to provide an affordable option compared to typical Uber fares of $80 to JFK.
- Customers can book rides for up to four passengers and validate their reservations with QR codes.
- Service operates on four routes from locations in Manhattan and Brooklyn, every 30 minutes from 5 AM to 10:45 PM.
- Uber partners with ETS, a licensed shuttle operator, and has previously launched shuttle services for concerts and other airports.

items.title: Poco’s F7 Ultra is a midrange phone with a flagship chip
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Poco F7 Ultra features the Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, priced at £649 (approx. $835).
- It includes a triple rear camera setup: 50MP main, 50MP telephoto (2.5x), and 32MP ultrawide, with a 32MP selfie camera.
- The 6.67-inch OLED display has a 1440p resolution and a 120Hz refresh rate; it houses a 5,300mAh battery with 120W wired and 50W wireless charging.
- Comes with an IP68 rating for dust and water resistance, but uses Poco’s own Shield Glass for display protection.
- There's a less expensive F7 Pro model at £499 (approx. $645) with the Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 and a downgraded camera setup available in the UK and Europe.

items.title: Robinhood is launching bank accounts that will deliver physical cash ‘to your doorstep’
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Robinhood announced the launch of a wholly online banking platform called Robinhood Banking in fall 2023.
- The platform will offer checking and savings accounts for Robinhood Gold subscribers, including cash delivery to users' doorsteps based on location.
- Customers will earn a 4% annual percentage yield (APY) and enjoy FDIC insurance up to $2.5 million through a partnership with Coastal Community Bank.
- New accounts will include individual, joint, and children’s options, addressing challenges of legacy banks.
- Robinhood will also release a wealth management platform named Robinhood Strategies with managed ETFs and stocks for a fee of 0.25%.
- An AI-powered investment tool called Cortex is set to launch later this year, providing market insights to Gold subscribers.

items.title: Republicans push for child safety laws amid concerns over FTC enforcement
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- House Energy and Commerce subcommittee discussed child online safety, a typically bipartisan topic, with rising tensions.
- Republicans aim to revive the blocked Kids Online Safety Act (KOSA) while Democrats question FTC enforcement capacity after recent firings by Trump.
- Trump's illegal attempt to fire Democratic FTC commissioners raises concerns about accountability and transparency in enforcing child safety laws.
- Democrats emphasize the importance of having effective enforcement for laws like KOSA and COPPA 2.0, warning that without the FTC, the legislation is ineffective.
- The political landscape complicates discussions of child safety measures, as critiques grow regarding the influence of Big Tech on Republican priorities.

items.title: Nothing’s colorful, entry-level earbuds have fallen to their best price to date
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Nothing Ear (a) earbuds are on sale for $77.50 on [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/Nothing-Ear-Integration-Cancelling-Equaliser/dp/B0D2XYTB85/?th=1&tag=theverge02-20), a $23 discount.
- They feature active noise cancellation (ANC), decent sound quality, and customizable settings via the Nothing app.
- The earbuds support multipoint Bluetooth pairing and a low-latency gaming mode, alongside unique features like ChatGPT integration for Nothing phone users.

items.title: Trump Plans 25% Tariff on Imported Vehicles
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- President Trump announced a 25% tariff on imported vehicles effective April 2, 2025.
- The tariffs will apply to cars and trucks imported into the US, including those made by American companies abroad.
- Trump claims the tariffs will lead to growth in the auto industry but will likely increase consumer prices by approximately 5% according to a 2024 USITC analysis.
- The tariffs will coincide with other reciprocal tariffs expected to affect various trading partners.

items.title: Microsoft revamps its Windows Game Bar
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Microsoft announced updates to Xbox for March, including a new design for Game Bar on PC.
- The Game Bar now features a cleaner user interface with lighter colors and a simpler layout.
- Xbox Cloud Gaming allows players to switch between games without returning to the Home page, starting with select “Assassin's Creed” titles.
- In-game benefits are expanding to more free-to-play titles including “Heroes in the Storm” and “Call of Duty: Warzone” in April, allowing players to earn cosmetics and currency.

items.title: Amazon’s Big Spring Sale Offers 75 Best Deals Ahead of Prime Day
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Amazon's Big Spring Sale is live from now until March 31, 2025.
- Discounts are available on gardening supplies, bedding, security cameras, headphones, smartwatches, and more tech products.
- Items available at competitors include deals from Best Buy, Walmart, and Target.
- Featured deals include a $76 Anker wall charger, $34 Hoto electric screwdriver, $150 Shokz headphones, and $170 Apple AirPods Pro with improved features.

items.title: ChatGPT’s new image generator is delayed for free users
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- OpenAI delays the rollout of ChatGPT’s image generator for free users due to unexpected popularity.
- CEO Sam Altman announced the delay in a post on Wednesday.
- Image generation capabilities were added to ChatGPT recently, using GPT-4o model.
- The new tool allows users to create images, including styles like Studio Ghibli.
- Currently available for ChatGPT Plus, Pro, and Team subscribers; no timeline for free users yet.

items.title: YouTube Shorts will count views even if you scroll past
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- YouTube will change its Shorts view counting method starting March 31st, similar to TikTok and Instagram.
- Views will count when a Short starts to play or replay, not just after a specific duration.
- YouTube aims to align creators' view counts across platforms and may result in higher reported view counts.
- Old metrics will still be tracked under 'engaged views' for analytics and creator earnings.

items.title: Marvel unveils the gigantic cast for Avengers: Doomsday
Some Kindles now let you double-tap anywhere to turn the page
Amazon Spring Sale deals on Verge staff home favorites
The Shokz OpenRun Pro 2 are worth their full price, but are more tempting at $30 off
The best foldable phone you can buy
Apple blocked from presenting at Google antitrust hearing where $20 billion search deal is at stake
The 20 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $30
Microsoft’s account sign-in UI gets a new design and dark mode
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft is rolling out a new sign-in screen for over a billion users that includes a dark mode and is based on Fluent 2 design.
- The redesign emphasizes a passwordless authentication experience, reducing cognitive load and speeding up the sign-in process.
- Initial rollout begins for Xbox users, with web and mobile apps receiving updates throughout March and April, while consumer profiles only will see these changes.

items.title: Canon redesigned its entry-level EOS R50 with improved video capabilities
Roborock’s S8 MaxV Ultra, our favorite robovac, is cheaper than ever
Rivian spins out secret e-bike lab into a new company called Also
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Rivian launched a new micromobility company named Also, securing $105 million in Series B funding from Eclipse.
- The focus of Also will be on lightweight electric vehicles such as bikes and scooters.
- Rivian's CEO RJ Scaringe highlighted the need for diverse electrified transport options.
- The company has been working on a micromobility program for several years, with plans to file trademarks for e-bikes and scooters.
- Rivian aims to feature Also's products in its retail locations while retaining a minority ownership stake in the new company.

items.title: Wyze’s new camera filter claims to cut down on nuisance alerts
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Wyze introduces the "No Big Deal" AI filter aimed at reducing irrelevant notifications from security cameras.
- The filter prioritizes important alerts like "Person breaking into car" and limits repeated notices for ongoing activities.
- The NBD Filter is part of the $19.99/month or $199.99/year Cam Unlimited Pro subscription, using AI to rank alerts from 1 to 5.
- It builds on previously launched Descriptive Alerts that provide detailed descriptions of detected events.
- Similar features are emerging from competitors like Ring and Google Nest, yet Wyze is the first with this targeted notification filtering.

items.title: This company is using AI to give people American-sounding accents
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Krisp launches AI tool to convert accents to American English in real time.
- The tool integrates with video conferencing apps (e.g., Zoom, Microsoft Teams) and maintains a 200ms latency.
- Currently supports over 17 Indian dialects; plans to add more English accents in the future.
- Initially rolled out to call center agencies, now in beta for broader users with a 60-minute daily free limit or a $15/month plan for unlimited access.
- Other companies, like Teleperformance SE, are also exploring AI to modify worker accents, but concerns about AI's implications on race and ethnicity exist.

items.title: World of Warcraft will rollback some Hardcore mode permadeaths
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Blizzard will allow some characters in Hardcore mode to return to life following DDoS attacks targeting players.
- Hardcore mode in WoW Classic is known for permanent character deaths.
- The decision responds to attacks affecting the OnlyFangs raiding guild, prompting concerns from its members, including Twitch streamer soadapoppin.
- Future revivals may occur during mass events that threaten game integrity, as stated by Blizzard's associate production director Clay Stone.

items.title: Metaphor: ReFantazio’s elaborate menus are designed to heighten your emotions
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- The video game *Metaphor: ReFantazio* features menus designed to enhance player emotions.
- Lead designer Koji Ise aimed to match UI with players' feelings during gameplay.
- Developed by Atlus, *Metaphor* is a spiritual successor to the *Persona* series, set in a fantasy realm instead of modern-day Japan.
- Ise leveraged his background in website design to create interactive animations for the game.
- Design started visually and moved towards functional interface aspects, incorporating elements from *Persona*.
- The challenge was to reflect emotional intensity through menu design, particularly during combat.
- Balancing aesthetic and practical UI requirements was key to the design process.
- Despite the complexities, the team aimed for an unforgettable design that serves as the title's face.

items.title: The base iPad is finally being left behind
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- The 11th-generation iPad shows good performance for basic tasks but struggles with more intensive applications and multitasking.
- Geekbench tests reveal that its performance lags significantly compared to the iPad Air models.
- The base iPad does not support the latest accessories like the newest Apple Pencil or Magic Keyboard.
- It is priced at $349, making it a good budget option for casual users, but may not be future-proof for heavy users or gamers.

items.title: The Nissan Leaf lives on as a compact SUV with a Tesla charge port
The Atlantic releases strike group chat messages
Reolink’s wireless camera easily transitions from vanlife to homelife
items.author: Thomas Ricker
items.summary:
- The Reolink Argus 4 Pro is a battery-powered 4K security camera suitable for both vanlife and homelife.
- Connects via Starlink Wi-Fi with no need for SIM card or data plan; IP66 rated for indoor and outdoor use.
- Features a dual-lens system for 180-degree field of view and night vision with motion detection.
- Records to SD card (up to 512GB), eliminating recurring cloud storage fees.
- Priced at $107.99 or $119.99 with solar panel for extended use.
- Positive aspects include low price, 4K recording, and smart alerts.
- Drawbacks include reliance on Wi-Fi, noisy nighttime footage, and issues with the app's usability.

items.title: Porsche’s next Taycan gets an infotainment upgrade — but no new CarPlay
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- The 2026 Taycan, 911, Panamera, and Cayenne will have an upgraded infotainment system with the Porsche Communication Management (PCM) software.
- New system includes Amazon Alexa for personal assistance and will be available in the Macan Electric.
- The models still use the traditional CarPlay; no mention of the new-generation CarPlay.
- Features include Dolby Atmos support in models with premium audio systems like Bose.
- 10 years of Porsche Connect service included to enhance the digital user experience.
- The vehicles can be ordered now and are set to arrive in US stores by late summer 2025.

items.title: Microsoft adds ‘deep reasoning’ Copilot AI for research and data analysis
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- Microsoft introduced two deep reasoning agents, Researcher and Analyst, for Microsoft 365 Copilot.
- Researcher utilizes OpenAI's model for complex research and connects to third-party data like Salesforce.
- Analyst, based on OpenAI's o3-mini reasoning model, can create spreadsheets and run Python code, functioning at a data scientist's level.
- The rollout for these tools starts in April as part of an early access program for Microsoft 365 Copilot users.
- New capabilities for autonomous agents in Copilot Studio are also being released now, aimed at automating various tasks with AI.

items.title: Character.ai can now tell parents which bots their kid is talking to
items.author: Adi Robertson
items.summary:
- Character.AI introduces a ‘Parental Insights’ feature allowing teens to send weekly usage reports to parents.
- The report includes average daily usage time, frequently interacted characters, and time spent with each character.
- The feature is optional and doesn’t require parents to have an account; it provides an activity overview without sharing conversation content.
- Character.AI aims to address concerns over excessive chatbot use and inappropriate content for minors.
- The platform restricts access for users under 13 or 16 in Europe and has implemented changes following legal complaints about content issues.
- Recent updates involve moving under-18 users to a safer model and increasing warnings about chatbot interactions not being with real people.

items.title: Google says its new ‘reasoning’ Gemini AI models are the best ones yet
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- Google has introduced Gemini 2.5, an update to its AI models, improving performance with enhanced post-training capabilities.
- Gemini 2.5 Pro is reported to outpace competitors like OpenAI and Anthropic in various AI benchmarks, including understanding and mathematics.
- Gemini's multimodal capabilities allow it to interpret text, audio, images, video, and code, with a larger context window coming soon for better data processing.

items.title: EPA Workers Rally Against DOGE Cuts Amidst Deregulation Efforts
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- EPA workers protested in multiple cities against cuts imposed by President Trump and Elon Musk's DOGE, claiming these cuts jeopardize environmental protections.
- More than 150 workers rallied in New York City, chanting slogans and holding signs criticizing Musk.
- The protests were organized by union AFGE Council 238 on a 'National Day of Action' to combat planned rollbacks to regulatory measures aimed at pollution control.
- EPA now faces restrictions preventing it from taking enforcement actions unless there's an imminent health threat.
- Trump announced proposals that entail substantial deregulation efforts, aiming to roll back rules meant to curb pollution from various industries.
- Critics, including EPA employees, argue these actions undermine the agency's mission to protect human health and the environment, with calls for congressional action to intervene.

items.title: Amazon's Buy Two, Get One Free Deal on Movies
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Amazon is offering a buy two, get one free deal on 4K Blu-rays, standard Blu-rays, and DVDs.
- The promotion allows customers to add three qualifying movies to their cart, with the cheapest one being free at checkout.
- The deal includes popular titles from 2024, such as *Nosferatu*, *The Substance*, and *Alien: Romulus*.
- To play 4K Blu-rays, buyers need a PlayStation 5 with a disc drive, an Xbox Series X, or a standalone 4K Blu-ray player.
- Other notable titles in the promotion include recent 4K re-releases of *Kill Bill*, *Akira*, and the *The Lord of the Rings* trilogy.

items.title: Game Informer has officially returned
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Game Informer is back online, acquired by Gunzilla Games.
- The magazine was previously owned by GameStop, which shuttered it last August.
- Editor-in-chief Matt Miller announced the return and future plans for the magazine.
- Game Informer will operate independently and will also revive its print edition.
- New membership benefits are planned, and the site will provide ongoing coverage of gaming news.

items.title: AT&T is slashing its autopay and paperless billing discounts
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Starting April 24th, AT&T will reduce its autopay discount from $10 to $5 for debit card users.
- The previous $5 discount for paperless billing and autopay customers with a credit card will be discontinued, now applying only to AT&T Plus Card holders from Citi.
- A $10 discount for autopay customers using bank accounts will remain in place.
- AT&T states this change is to align with industry standards, following similar adjustments by T-Mobile and Verizon.

items.title: The Kindle Colorsoft is now a far better deal thanks to Amazon’s Big Spring Sale
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
- The Kindle Colorsoft is on sale for $224.99, reduced from the original price of $279.99.
- Sale valid from March 25, 2025.
- The Colorsoft features E Ink's first color display, 32GB storage, waterproofing, and wireless charging.
- Known for faster page turns, auto-adjusting front light, and long battery life of up to two months.
- Currently the only Kindle e-reader with color capabilities in the market.

items.title: Anker’s ‘InstaCord’ battery with dual retractable USB-C cables is 20 percent off
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Anker’s 25,000mAh portable battery, the InstaCord, is currently discounted by 20% to $87.99 from its original price of $109.99 during Amazon’s Big Spring Sale.
- The power bank features two retractable USB-C cables, one of which doubles as a carrying loop.
- It supports up to 165W total charging power and includes three USB-C ports and one USB-A port, allowing for charging multiple devices simultaneously.

items.title: GM-backed ‘coast-to-coast’ EV charging network grows to 130 locations
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- GM, EVgo, and Pilot have installed EV chargers at 130 locations across 25 states as part of a coast-to-coast charging network.
- The partnership aims to have 2,000 DC fast chargers at 500 Pilot and Flying J truck stop locations.
- The expanded network includes routes along I-75 and major highways between cities such as Minneapolis, Milwaukee, Detroit, Cleveland, San Antonio, Houston, Dallas, and Nashville.
- Each charging station is designed with gas station-style canopies and can accommodate multiple vehicles with fast charging capabilities.
- The charging system can provide a boost to compatible EVs in as little as 15 minutes, but typical charging times for most EVs range from 30 minutes for a 20-80% charge.

items.title: Why I love the Calligraphr font-creation app
items.author: Kristen Radtke
items.summary:
- **Calligraphr** is a web-based app that turns handwriting into fonts, requiring only a printer and a phone camera.
- It is **affordable**, with the paid version costing $8/month or $24/6 months.
- Kristen hosted a **font-making workshop** in March, allowing friends to create their fonts quickly and effortlessly.
- The app offers great **customization options**, including letter variants and ligature functions for cursive writing.
- Users can adjust **spacing and padding** for each letter to improve readability.
- It is recommended for anyone wanting a **handwriting font**, whether for fun or professional use.

items.title: Amazon’s new James Bond movie will be produced by Amy Pascal and David Heyman
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Amazon MGM has hired Amy Pascal and David Heyman to produce a new James Bond film.
- Pascal has previously worked on Sony’s Spider-Man franchise and multiple Bond films such as Casino Royale and Skyfall.
- Heyman produced all eight Harry Potter films and is currently involved in HBO/Max's Harry Potter reimagined series.
- Both producers expressed honor in taking stewardship of the Bond franchise, following Barbara Broccoli and Michael Wilson.
- Courtenay Valenti, head of film at Amazon MGM, emphasized the studio's responsible approach to the Bond IP.
